website_summaries.verdict: The radiator cleaner package to choose when you want a large supply for a small price.
pros: Two-in-one formula flushes debris from the radiator while cleaning surfaces for better performance
Good at removing large buildups and deposits of heavy metals caught in the radiator
cons: Cleaning performance may not be as good as some other options

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for heater core flush
customer_reviews.text: This started because I didn’t have very hot heat in my car. It was more like luke warm so I purchased this to flush my heater core. Using some hoses that I picked up from the hardware store I put the whole bottle into the heater core and let it sit for an hour. Flushed it out, put things back together,and filled the radiator. I let the car heat up and my heat was back, not like new, but good enough. I may flush it again in a few months to see if that helps more, but this did what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: TBarney

customer_reviews.title: Run the engine with distilled nit overheating and let sit overnight.
customer_reviews.text: I dont like prestone but this is citri acid. A diluted foush at 100k in distilled water then let it sit overnight cleans well. Not ideal for some vehicles that say otherwise but most if not a regular thing would do alright. I stress diluted in distilled water. People who hype how it cleared garbage when they dumped in in coolant are morons. Mix any random garbage with your coolant and you create a sludge. Drain the radiator and flush with distilled water until drain fluid clear. Then use this. Then flush several kore times with distilled sonthis doesn't get left behind and mix with the new coolant.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: When it just has to be cleaned.
customer_reviews.text: This was part 1 of a 2 part radiator flush and clean in a GM vehicle that appears to have had nothing but GM Dexcool antifreeze/coolant. The stuff that appears to require a flush and fill every 5 years or thereabouts. Or it becomes very distressing and ineffective internally. And not knowing when the last flush and fill was completed... This was an absolute necessity. A great first round cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Buccaneer

customer_reviews.title: my coolant system probably wasn't that dirty anyway, yet it still seemed to find some ...
customer_reviews.text: After replacing so many parts, my coolant system probably wasn't that dirty anyway, yet it still seemed to find some dirt in the system that came out, that did not come out with just water.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Kanwisher

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value
customer_reviews.text: This arrived fast. It came well packaged and it was incredible what a low cost it was compared to all other stires, including online sites. Packaging was goid. It is brand new. It worked just fine and I decided on rhis product since it has no chances of damaging aluminum parts in my auto's modern day engine. It worked like a charm. Great service.
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Highly highly recommend! My husband's radiator was rusted and all through the water pump and hoses from the previous owner. The water is now clear! We have tried other ways to rid the rust and this is the only thing that has worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Young

customer_reviews.title: this stuff works
customer_reviews.text: it works great. I used one full bottle to clean and flush the entire coolong system by following the direction. after 4 days, i drained the chemical and flushed it with distilled water few times
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worked good using the regular flush instructions
customer_reviews.text: Worked good using the regular flush instructions, but wish I'd done the extended as the block still had hardened rust/scale left in it. Would recommend driving for a few days with this in the system, the quick flush doesn't give it enough time to work.
customer_reviews.author: Rob F.

customer_reviews.title: Had no issues.
customer_reviews.text: I used this flush over the summer to clean out my coolant system. My coolant was pretty clean as it was so I was just using the flush as a preventative measure. I used as directed and refilled with fresh coolant. No issues and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mastayugi91

customer_reviews.title: works fine, but if your coolant system is on good order, unnecessary
customer_reviews.text: if you've neglected your coolant for too long, a good flush with this product is probably worth it. however if you change the coolant every 2-3 yrs using the same stuff, there is no sediment or rust to remove. this product is probably not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne DeJulia

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t find this locally, but was able to find it on amazon for basically the same price. Used two bottles to do a super flush on the cooling system for my 90s pickup and it really did the job. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P.E.

customer_reviews.title: Does some work, not much
customer_reviews.text: I used it for flushing/cleaning my 2013 Accord's radiator circuit. I opted to do 10-min cycle. After third rinse with clean coolant, I could still see dirt in the drained liquid showing there are still deposits in the system. Maybe it is a good idea to use two bottles combined for the first rinse cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a chemical flush
customer_reviews.text: Poured the chemical flush about 4 days before doing a coolant flush. After the 4 days, the coolant liquid came out dark brown / black, so it looks like it worked. I have not noticed any difference in engine temp or how the car runs so i guess that's a good thing. Will buy it again
customer_reviews.author: vj987

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item does precisely what it says on the package. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Volk

customer_reviews.title: Six pack, a good value!
customer_reviews.text: My V10 truck has a high capacity cooling system, so two bottles required for Clean/Flush. Balance to my supply cabinet for the “family fleet”.
customer_reviews.author: Auto Tech Instructor

customer_reviews.title: Flush
customer_reviews.text: My truck was older,couldn't;t tell if it even needed flushed. just doing maintenance. I would buy again,
customer_reviews.author: Farley Scott Orndorff

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product cleaned out my coolant system well. I had to use two separate cleaning to get it thoroughly cleaned out. It also kept my engine operable in the Florida heat for several days.
customer_reviews.author: JMK

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This product did a great job in removing all the rust in the coolant system.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Flush
customer_reviews.text: Worked well but had to flush three times to get oil out of water system
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Clear instructions on bottle. Will never pay to have radiator flushed again.
customer_reviews.author: Keng

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned most, but not all of radiator
customer_reviews.text: I think the radiator flush and cleaner worked as described, but I flushed the radiator 2 more times and still had murky gray water coming out. I had expected a clean flush after the 2nd flush. But maybe that is how this product works. In any case, I got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stegman

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned out the engine good enough for blue devil to do it's job
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E.

customer_reviews.title: Gets Rid Of the Rust and Gunk
customer_reviews.text: I've used this now to do a home flush on both our Ford F150 pickup, and Honda Element. Does a nice job of cleaning out the rust and gunk! I've watched it wash away. Just follow the directions on the bottle and you'll also be in good shape. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Family

customer_reviews.title: Do the extended flush for best results
customer_reviews.text: Seem to clean out system well. I ran it for a week with distilled water and heater core blowing warmer after.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Worked just as advertised got a crap ton of floaters out of my system
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Use this if you want a clean cooling system - or suffer the consequences!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Cooling system is now clean as a whistle. $0.88 per gallon distilled H2O at Walmart. No tap! Flushed AND filled with distilled H2O and Prestone products.
customer_reviews.author: Stevay2005

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great product. Removed a lot of junk from the inside of my Ford F250 V10 engine. Would use again.
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what we needed it for so 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: More stuff came out than I'm happy about. Lots of brown/tan powder
customer_reviews.text: got 3 bottles for a 2.8gallon system. Put 1 in and flushed for 10mins then used the other 2 over a day. More stuff came out than I'm happy about. Lots of brown/tan powder. A few metal shavings (not sure why). Long life 5 year toyota coolant was in my tacoma for 6 years and 80,000 miles + block heater in winter. I would recommend this product. I did not think I had any corrosion in the system. This proved I had mild corrosion. Heater core gained 10-20F & is now north of 150F.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Great Radiator Rejuvenation Treatment
customer_reviews.text: Drained 102,000-mile radiator, poured this Radiator Flush in, then rinsed with 3 gallons of distilled water. Clean!
customer_reviews.author: Gian Italo Voglino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got all kind of crud out of my cooling system!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if works.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it did anything. I ran the car for a few days with this in. Thought the antifreeze would come out with more dirt after the flush. Used regular antifreeze instead of the recommended motorcraft on my lincoln and it left scaling and debris stuck everywhere. Clogged my heater core. The flush did not fix.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa santiago

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I bought my truck used from a dealer with more than 100 grand on the engine. The dealer had some records but not all because the man didn't always go to the dealer for repairs. The color of my antifreeze was dark and dirty. Followed the instructions on the bottle and wow what a difference. The flush water took 3 full flushes to run clear. even 3 months after doing flush new coolant is still nice green clear color. The engine and radiators must have needed it pretty bad.
customer_reviews.author: mrtwstrs

customer_reviews.title: now nice and clean
customer_reviews.text: helped clean out radiator before flushing, now nice and clean, left in car for 3 days before flushing.
customer_reviews.author: BILLUAL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great on my 1996 maxima, everything came out clean
customer_reviews.author: Rafy Rin

customer_reviews.title: My coolant has been nice and clear since - no rust or gunk
customer_reviews.text: The previous owner put the cheap green stuff in my Toyota Corolla, so I flushed it and cleaned the system out using this. My coolant has been nice and clear since - no rust or gunk. Pro-tip: When you flush your radiator, replace the radiator spring clamp with a worm gear hose clamp; it is much easier to replace!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well to clean out calcium deposits in radiator and clean out system. Used on 1979 Jeep in conjunction with flush and fill kit.
customer_reviews.author: Marine

customer_reviews.title: I ran this flush for 2 days and it didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I ran this flush for 2 days and it didn't clean off all of the stuff I think it should have. It also kept making foam after a few distilled water flushes, but eventually that did go away before I filled my system back up with coolant.
customer_reviews.author: MrMoo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price, agressive results.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price, aggressive results. Using this to perform a full flush on my cooling system and only driving less than 10 miles and seeing my Dex-cool (orange color coolant) became quite murky so it's already doing a great job. i'll be running this through my system for a few days then flush my system. So far I'm very impressed with this product so far. Update: flush is complete and the results of using this were fantastic. Got a ton of grit out of the coolant system and am very pleased with how everything is now.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: This prestone radiator flush is very good stuff would buy it again did a great job ...
customer_reviews.text: This prestone radiator flush is very good stuff would buy it again did a great job flushing my radiator and engine block out. Thanks. Terry Barnes S R
customer_reviews.author: Terry J Barnes

customer_reviews.title: I recommend using it with distilled water and drive it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it before. It works well for flushing. I recommend using it with distilled water and drive it for a few miles with the heater on max
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a professional job you would get at a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as a professional job you would get at a dealer or repair shop.... They us the same stuff
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Good product but maybe not that useful in hondas or cars with no visible gunk.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to clean 2003 odyssey radiator. 13 year old car. I drove the car about 60 miles before flushing out the prestone water mix. Nothing came out except water (no amount of visible sediments when tested in a trasparent cup). But maybe honda coolant protection was great. I think I over thought this and maybe a normal coolant exchange or drain and fill was good enough and less trouble trying to find distilled water. Many forums suggest to use distilled water (some folks using tap water have had no complaints though too)
customer_reviews.author: anchal

customer_reviews.title: Its what I ordered: ) necessary but not exciting ...
customer_reviews.text: Its what I ordered :) necessary but not exciting! haha
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Michael

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: The crud that came out of that truck, wow. Unfortunately I cannot tell you if it was because of this because I can't go back in time and flush it without it, but it was nice to know that it may have helped and it wasn't that expensive. I threw it in a few days before with mostly water and it looks like it could have helped. I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Greenz

customer_reviews.title: Prestone radiator cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Drain the anti freeze first, drive around with this stuff in for a day or so, repeat the process, then drain and fill water until clear. Drain once more and add fresh anti freeze and you will be all set.
customer_reviews.author: nemo

customer_reviews.title: I would look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: Added to bottles to my system and it barely made any difference. I even kept it in the system over a period of 4 days. I would look elsewhere for a more effective product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Mixes readily with water.
customer_reviews.text: Double flushed the radiator on my 2002 GMC truck. I guess this stuff worked. How do you tell unless you do 50 radiators a year?
customer_reviews.author: AlaskaMan

customer_reviews.title: possible cause of radiator leaking
customer_reviews.text: It seems to have worked fine but I suspect it may have caused my radiator to start leaking. It was fine before but maybe I left in running in the car too long? It was left over a few days per the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: RZL

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it at all
customer_reviews.text: This stuff did not do what I thought it would have. Good thing it wasn't too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: C S

customer_reviews.title: It works great. See ChrisFix on YouTube to see how the product works, search "Super Flush"
customer_reviews.text: My go to cleaner. If you watch YouTube tutorials, ChrisFix does auto repairs and used this product (with the label covered, and did not mention the brand or product) and he demonstrates how well it works with multiple flushes. I did it to my truck, but my cooling system wasn't dirty after all, so I only used one bottle over a few days and it still cleaned nicely. I did two flushes total. I have a spare bottle and I would be happy to buy again and recommend this for others.
customer_reviews.author: Remrie Arrie

customer_reviews.title: Worked as intended but i give it 3 stars because ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as intended but i give it 3 stars because i had to send it back once because it busted ooen and leaked over the rest of my order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flush rust?
customer_reviews.text: Engine had rust, followed directions, seems like plain water flush would have done just as well.
customer_reviews.author: M Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was time for a major flushing of the system.
customer_reviews.author: BRR50

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Maintenance Booster
customer_reviews.text: You should flush your radiator every couple of years, it's inexpensive, really easy, and keeps your cars temp in check. This is just one, very inexpensive, and very helpful addition to that process. Put it in with distilled water. Drive to work and back for 2 or 3 days then drain and watch the iced tea that drains out. WARNING: Drained liquid will not actually contain Iced Tea, DO NOT DRINK.
customer_reviews.author: M.H. Sapien

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like it was a good price!?
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving it four stars cuz I can't see into the cooling system to check for cleanliness. Seemed to work though.
customer_reviews.author: Jackzn

customer_reviews.title: my vent setting smells like exhaust now
customer_reviews.text: Would not do again, my vent setting smells like exhaust now, unusable.
customer_reviews.author: EA

product_meta.title: Prestone AS105-6PK Radiator Flush and Cleaner - 22 oz, (Pack of 6)
product_meta.description: Size:22 Ounce, (Pack of 6)Prestone Radiator Flush and Cleaner is a 2-in-1 formula designed for light flushing and heavy-duty cleaning for cooling systems to help prevent overheating, the #1 cause of engine failure. This premium formulation is designed to remove heavy rust and scale deposits in neglected cooling systems. These deposits can dramatically restrict coolant flow and reduce heat transfer, which may lead to possible overheating, breakdown, or costly repair. A super-chelating additive effectively removes heavy deposits by drawing metal oxides into the solution. Though strong enough to help restore maximum cooling system efficiency, this non-toxic, non-acidic product is easy-to-use and safe for all cooling system metals.
feature_bullets: 2-in-1 formula designed for light flushing and heavy-duty cleaning
Cleans cooling systems to help prevent overheating
Non-toxic, non-acidic formula is easy-to-use and safe for all cooling system metals
Effectively removes heavy deposits by drawing metal oxides into the solution
Strong enough to help restore maximum cooling system efficiency
